text: This is a list of public holidays in Pakistan. ==Holidays in Pakistan== Date English Name Local Name Remarks 5 February Kashmir Solidarity Day Youm-e- Yekjehty-e-Kashmir Protest against Indian occupation of Kashmir. 23 March Pakistan Day Youm-e-Pakistan For the passing of the Lahore Resolution, when a separate nation for the Muslims of The British Indian Empire was demanded. 1 May Labour Day Youm-e-Mazdoor Labour Day in Pakistan 28 May Youm-e-Takbeer Yōum-e-Takbīr Commemorates the Chagai-I and Chagai-II series of nuclear tests. 14 August Independence Day Youm-e-Azadi For Pakistan's independence from the United Kingdom on August 14, 1947 9 November Iqbal Day Youm-e-Iqbal Birthday of national poet Muhammad Iqbal 25 December Quaid-e-Azam Day Youm-e-Viladat-e- Quaid-e-Azam Birthday of Quaid-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah Dates following the Lunar Islamic calendar Dhul Hijja 10th Eid ul-Adha For the end of Haj. The sacrifice offered on this day is for Abraham's willingness to sacrifice his son. It is on the 10th day of the month of Dhul Hijja Shawwal 1st Eid ul-Fitr For the end of Ramadan (Ramazan). It is on the 1st and 2nd day of Shawwal Rabi`-ul-Awwal 12th Eid Milad-un-Nabi Birthday of the Islamic Prophet, Muhammad. It is on the 12th of Rabi'-ul-Awwal Muharram 9th & 10th Ashura Martyrdom of Imam Hussain. It is on 9th and 10th day of Muharram ==References== Category:Holidays of Pakistan
title: Public holidays in Pakistan
